newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS - factors to watch - Nov 1.
newsitem.headline: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS - factors to watch - Nov 1.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors affecting Indian stock markets on Friday morning:
** Indian authorities arrests two former chairmen of tobacco conglomerate ITC Ltd early on Friday in a widening investigation into alleged foreign exchange violations
The enforcement directorate said former chairmen K L Chugh and J N Sapru were arrested and put in police custody in the eastern state of Calcutta
** Top firms Tata Iron & Steel Company Ltd (TISCO), scooter maker Bajaj Auto and utility vehicles manufacturer Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) unveil good first half results

** The Industry Minister has cleared 63 proposals recommended by the Foreign Investment Promotion Board (FIPB), amounting to 24.28 billion rupees foreign direct investment (FDI), the Economic Times says
** The Reserve Bank of India on Thursday announced guidelines for banks to lend from expatriate Indian's dollar accounts
** The Indian rupee INR= opened steady at 35.65/66 per dollar on Friday. Increased dollar supply seen strengthening the rupee, dealers say
** Indian shares treaded cautiously on Thursday ahead of first-half results of top companies
The 30-share index of the Bombay Stock Exchange .BSESN ended 9.20 points, or 0.29 percent, lower at 3,163.78, after sliding to 3,122.76.
The 50-stock National Stock Exchange index .NSEI fell 17.07 points, or 1.84 percent, to 909.29.
** TISCO, India's largest private steel firm, surprised market watchers on Thursday with a sharp rise in first half pre-tax profits, brokers said
The firm said its profits before taxes jumped 44 percent to 2.89 billion rupees in the six months to September 30, 1996 from 2.01 billion in the same period a year ago
** Scooter maker Bajaj Auto said its net profit rose 27 percent to 2.26 billion rupees in the six-month 1996/97 (April-March) against 1.77 billion in the year-ago period
** Utility and tractor maker M&M said its net profit increased 25 percent to 924.3 million rupees from 738.10 million
** Tata Engineering and Locomotive Co Ltd, India's biggest truck maker, to release first half results later on Friday
